page.title: 08COMMUNICATIONS-LOCHAR MOSS
page.content: On our visit to {HIGHTOWN OF CRAIGS} ,which we have detailed on Page 5 and 6,Steven asked what forms of communications there were.He was told by Mr. Telfer that there was no bus service or visiting vans such as bakers,butchers e.t.c.Their only forms of communication are the post van which comes once a day and the milk tanker which comes twice a day.It was explained to us that if any of the local people wanted anything in the way of supplies then they had to find their own means of transport to reach Dumfries which is approximately 5 miles from Hightown of Craigs.
